description.narrative: To step up from the community level to the country level to increase the effectiveness and to improve the results of the sanitation development efforts the ZDSP is combining earlier dry sanitation projects as a larger country program including several proj ect sites situated in urban and peri-urban settlements and outskirts of Lusaka Monze Livingstone and Kitwe.Project Outcomes- Better participation of Zambia Government+stakeholders to address poor sanitation in the country- Change of behaviour: the usage of DT's DT outputs as fertilizers+improved hygiene knowledge+practises- Reduction of water borne diseases - Providing scientific evidence of the safety and effectiveness of using urine and compost in agriculture+forestry- Income generation through CBE's+SME' sThe key activities:- Construction of dry sanitation (UDDT-toilets) facilities+water points- Awareness creation and education (sensitization stakeholders media) - Demand creation social marketing creating livelihood among the beneficiaries- Advocacy (eg. n ational provincial+local policies +practices)- Agricultural and Forestry (re-use of urine + compost)- Research (agriculture safety sensitisation)The local partners: - Livingstone Green Initiative (LGI) - Network of Environmental Concerns and Solutions (NEC OS)- Green Living Movement (GLM). Project works with several stakeholders eg. government local councils service providers areal groups training institutes and private entities.Cross-cutting issues:a) Human rights: the project activities focus on least priv ileged communities in Zambia takin into account disabilities; it provides them with a safer environment and a source of income from which they can provide for their basic needs.b) Gender equality: Improving WASH in schools and households benefits especiall y girls and women who are often resposible for WASH at homes. Both women and men participate and benefit from Dry toilet constructing and agriculture.c) Climate proofing: Dry toilets are flood and drought proof and thus adapted to climate change and variab ility as well as reduce the risk of disasters such as groundwater contamination and disease epidemics.
